definition: to fix/to settle/a libation to the dead
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order

sentences.english: Modernism provided the foundations for a genuinely new culture.
sentences.chinese: 現代主義爲一種全新的文化奠定了基礎。

sentences.english: It establishes the foundation for the next generation of client software.
sentences.chinese: 它們爲下一代客戶端軟件奠定了基礎。

sentences.english: Is your new number one starting to lay it on a little to thick?
sentences.chinese: 是你的新號碼一開始，奠定它在一個小到厚呢？

sentences.english: This study provides the experimental foundation for the further research of Aster ageratoides var.
sentences.chinese: 本研究爲長毛三脈紫菀的進一步研發奠定了實驗基礎。

sentences.english: The research can lay the foundation for further development of laser refabrication.
sentences.chinese: 爲進一步發展激光再製造技術奠定了良好的基礎。

sentences.english: The work provides a fundation for designing a dryer and optimizing the operation.
sentences.chinese: 上述工作爲乾燥器的設計及操作的優化奠定了基礎。

sentences.english: The new system came to define much about American life.
sentences.chinese: 這種新制度逐漸奠定了美國生活方式的基石。

sentences.english: These results would be a base for protection of the rice culture with the phytochemical pesticides.
sentences.chinese: 本研究爲開發防治稻曲病的植物源農藥奠定了基礎。

sentences.english: Square timber joists form the base layer and are laid across the span of the structure.
sentences.chinese: 方木擱柵形成的基礎層，是整個結構的跨度奠定。

sentences.english: These dedications make basis for the research on teacher's teaching reflection in primary school.
sentences.chinese: 以此爲小學教師教學反思的研究奠定理論基礎。

sentences.english: It established the theoretical base for the design of trenching implement.
sentences.chinese: 爲挖溝器的設計奠定了理論依據。

sentences.english: The conclusions lay the foundation of chip inductors .
sentences.chinese: 這爲貼片電感的製備奠定了基礎。

sentences.english: We laid the groundwork today for long-term prosperity, as well.
sentences.chinese: 我們今天也爲長期的繁榮奠定了基礎。

sentences.english: The results of this paper can provide some reference for the development of the low threshold, high-precision stray light measurement system.
sentences.chinese: 爲低閾值，高精度雜散光測量系統的研製奠定基礎。

sentences.english: Some have laid the groundwork for progress in the future.
sentences.chinese: 另外一些行動已爲未來取得進展奠定了基礎。

sentences.english: The research laid the foundation for the establishment of the prediction model for B. cinerea.
sentences.chinese: 該研究爲建立番茄灰黴病預測模型奠定了基礎。

definition: to lay (a foundation)/to conquer (a city etc)/to shoot down (a bird etc)
to break new ground (for agriculture)/to open up (a new seam)/to develop (border regions)/fig. to open up (new horizons)
